title: Strictly's Michelle Visage admits disbelief over Catherine Tyldesley's surprise exit
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest Strictly Come Dancing stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Strictly Come Dancing 2019 stars and viewers were equally stunned when Coronation Street actress Catherine Tyldesley was voted off the show this weekend.

Catherine and professional dance partner Johannes Radebe lost the dance-off against Mike Bushell and his partner Katya Jones.

The Corrie favourite was in tears as the result came in, with judges Bruno Tonioli and Motsi Mabuse opting to save her, before Head Judge Shirley Ballas overruled the vote and sent her home.

As the news was announced, furious viewers took to Twitter to blast the decision - and now her co-star Michelle has revealed her own reaction to the departure as she herself topped the leaderboard.

(Image: ITV)

Michelle and dance partner Giovanni Pernice's Halloween Week performance earned them their highest score, and the highest score of the series so far.

But her joy was slightly dampened by pal Catherine's exit.

She said on Lorraine: "I’m telling you, if they’d have kept the camera on me my jaw was on the ground.

(Image: BBC)

Sign up for our Strictly updates Love Strictly? Keep on top of all the news on and off the dancefloor with our regular email updates. Sign up using this form to receive our newsletter direct to your inbox, with the big breaking news and regular round-ups.

"I don't know, it goes to show you really don't know what is going to happen."

She went on to say how grateful she and Giovanni were for the public saving them for another week.

But she couldn't help feel sad for her friend Catherine and dance partner Johannes over their exit.

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

Michelle told Lorraine Kelly: "Cath and Johannes are two of my closest friends in the competition so I'm sad to see them go."

She added how the actress said she was happy to have made it to Halloween week, while insisting her own top score didn't secure her safety in the competition.

"By the time Saturday night happens and you're waiting for the result on Sunday, it's like 'okay, we're through so that's done,' you can’t even relish in that cos now there's a new dance."

Strictly Come Dancing continues next Saturday and Sunday on BBC One.
description: Strictly Come Dancing viewers were not expecting Coronation Street actress Catherine Tyldesley to leave the BBC series
